facts: Giant pandas are native to south central China.
Their diet consists almost exclusively of bamboo, though they are technically omnivores.
Pandas are an endangered species, primarily due to habitat loss and fragmentation.
They are known for their distinctive black and white fur, which helps them camouflage in snowy and rocky habitats.
A newborn panda cub is about the size of a stick of butter.
The blue whale is the largest animal known to have ever lived, reaching up to 98 feet (30 meters) in length and weighing over 190 tons.
They are baleen whales, feeding mainly on tiny crustaceans called krill, consuming up to 4 tons per day.
Blue whales can live for 80 to 90 years in the wild.
Their heart is about the size of a small car, and their blood vessels are so wide a human could swim through them.
Emperor penguins are the tallest and heaviest of all living penguin species.
They are endemic to Antarctica and breed during the Antarctic winter.
These penguins can dive to depths of over 500 meters (1,600 feet) and stay submerged for over 20 minutes.
Males incubate the single egg on their feet for over two months without eating.
